bibl.title: Martin J. McDonough v. Territory of Washington King County. Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: District Court of Washington Territory and the Third Judicial District

body.p: Whenfore, your petitioner prays that a Writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said John H. McGraw, commanding him to have the body of M.J. McDonough before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified, to do and vain what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning him. Together with the time and cause of his detention, and said writ, and that he may be restored to his liberty.
Territory of Washington } ss. County of King

M.J. McDonough being first duly sworn on oath says that he is the petitioner in the foregoing petition for a writ of Habeas Corpus that he has heard the said petition and knows all the facts therein stated and believed the same to be true
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 21st day of February 1887. A.A. Newlin Notary Public
5197 In the Dist. Court of Wash. by. and for the 3rd Judicial Dist. thereof holding terms at Seattle for the Counties of King + Kitsap
Territory of Washington Plaintiff. vs M.J. McDonough Defendant.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
(seal) FILED FEB 23 1887 James Seavy, Clerk. By James Ludlow Deputy Clerk
